intro: Drummondita microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved drummondia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Texas and New Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of pale yellow to greenish-white flowers. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in sandy or rocky soils, making it well adapted to its harsh desert environment. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects and animals. Drummondita microphylla is often found in open plains and along dry streambeds.
